def_en: A flag is a piece of cloth which can be attached to a pole and which is used as a sign, signal, or symbol of something, especially of a particular country.

def_cn: (在售旗募捐日出售或在某个位置上作标记用的)小旗，旗状物
def_en: A flag is a small piece of paper or cloth attached to a stick or pin which is sold on a flag day or used to mark a particular spot.

def_cn: 旗帜(新闻用语，代指某个国家、组织或其价值观、权力)
def_en: Journalists sometimes refer to the flag of a particular country or organization as a way of referring to the country or organization itself and its values or power.
If you flag or if your spirits flag, you begin to lose enthusiasm or energy.
See also:flagged; A flag is the same as a flagstone .

def_cn: (在国外时)表示并号召拥护自己的国家;（为少数人支持的事业)摇旗呐喊
def_en: If you fly the flag, you show that you are proud of your country, or that you support a particular cause, especially when you are in a foreign country or when few other people do.

def_cn: 挥手拦下，招手叫(尤指出租车)
def_en: If you flag down a vehicle, especially a taxi, you wave at it as a signal for the driver to stop.
